Useful to optimize the order of decoding tiles during animations and camera movements.<code>RequestController</code> is not extending \[\[AbortController\]\], because this is not supported in ES5. |

## Enumerations

|  Enumeration | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [ExprScope](./harp-datasource-protocol.exprscope.md) | The evaluation scope of an \[\[Expr\]\]. |
|  [GeometryType](./harp-datasource-protocol.geometrytype.md) | Geometry types supported by \[\[Geometry\]\] objects. |
|  [InterpolationMode](./harp-datasource-protocol.interpolationmode.md) | Interpolation mode used when computing a \[\[InterpolatedProperty\]\] value for a given zoom level. |
|  [PlacementToken](./harp-datasource-protocol.placementtoken.md) | Defines options (tokens) supported for text placements defined via \[\[placements\]\] attribute.<!-- -->Possible values are defined as vertical placement letter and horizontal letter, where one of the axis may be ignored and then assumed centered. Moving clock-wise, we have: <code>TL</code> (top-left), <code>T</code> (top-center), <code>TR</code> (top-right), <code>R</code> (center-right), <code>BR</code> (bottom-right), <code>B</code> (bottom-center), <code>BL</code> (bottom-left), <code>L</code> (left), <code>C</code> (center-center). Alternatively instead of <code>T</code>, <code>B</code>, <code>L</code>, <code>R</code> geographic directions may be used accordingly: <code>NW</code> (north-west), <code>N</code> (north), <code>NE</code> (north-east), <code>E</code> (east), <code>SE</code> (south-east), <code>S</code> (south), <code>SW</code> (south-west), <code>W</code> (west). |
|  [PoiStackMode](./harp-datasource-protocol.poistackmode.md) | Define the stacking option. Enum values for theme file are in "kebab-case". |
|  [StandardGeometryKind](./harp-datasource-protocol.standardgeometrykind.md) | Standard kinds of geometry. |
|  [StringEncodedNumeralType](./harp-datasource-protocol.stringencodednumeraltype.md) | Enumeration of supported string encoded numerals. |
|  [TextureCoordinateType](./harp-datasource-protocol.texturecoordinatetype.md) |  |

## Functions

|  Function | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [addBuffersToTransferList(technique, transferList)](./harp-datasource-protocol.addbufferstotransferlist.md) | Add all the buffers of the technique to the transfer list. |
|  [composeTechniqueTextureName(imageName, technique)](./harp-datasource-protocol.composetechniquetexturename.md) | Compose full texture name for given image name with technique specified. Some techniques allows to add prefix/postfix to icons names specified, this function uses technique information to create fully qualified texture name. |
|  [getArrayConstructor(attr)](./harp-datasource-protocol.getarrayconstructor.md) | Returns an array with the data type specified as parameter. |
|  [getFeatureId(attributeMap)](./harp-datasource-protocol.getfeatureid.md) |  |
|  [getFeatureName(env, basePropName, useAbbreviation, useIsoCode, languages)](./harp-datasource-protocol.getfeaturename.md) | Determine the name of (OMV) feature. It implements the special handling required to determine the text content of a feature from its tags, which are passed in as the <code>env</code>. |
|  [getFeatureText(context, technique, languages)](./harp-datasource-protocol.getfeaturetext.md) | Determine the text string of the map feature. It implements the special handling required to determine the text content of a feature from its tags, which are passed in as the <code>env</code>. |
|  [getProjection(projectionName)](./harp-datasource-protocol.getprojection.md) | Returns the projection object specified in the parameter. |
|  [getProjectionName(projection)](./harp-datasource-protocol.getprojectionname.md) | String with the projection's name. |
|  [getPropertyValue(property, env, cache)](./harp-datasource-protocol.getpropertyvalue.md) | Get the value of the specified property in given <code>env</code>. |
|  [interpolatedPropertyDefinitionToJsonExpr(property)](./harp-datasource-protocol.interpolatedpropertydefinitiontojsonexpr.md) | Converts an \[\[InterpolatedPropertyDefinition\]\] to a \[\[JsonExpr\]\]. |

|  [BaseLight](./harp-datasource-protocol.baselight.md) |  |
|  [BaseTechniqueParams](./harp-datasource-protocol.basetechniqueparams.md) | Common attributes or all \[\[Technique\]\]s. |
|  [BaseValueDefinition](./harp-datasource-protocol.basevaluedefinition.md) | Value definition commons. |
|  [BasicExtrudedLineTechnique](./harp-datasource-protocol.basicextrudedlinetechnique.md) | Runtime representation of \[\[BasicExtrudedLineStyle\]\] as parsed by \[\[StyleSetEvaluator\]\]. For technique parameters see \[\[BasicExtrudedLineTechniqueParams\]\]. |
|  [BasicExtrudedLineTechniqueParams](./harp-datasource-protocol.basicextrudedlinetechniqueparams.md) | Declares a a geometry as a basic extruded line. |
|  [BoxedAnyDefinition](./harp-datasource-protocol.boxedanydefinition.md) | Boxed definition without type. |
|  [BoxedBooleanDefinition](./harp-datasource-protocol.boxedbooleandefinition.md) | A boxed boolean value definition. |
|  [BoxedColorDefinition](./harp-datasource-protocol.boxedcolordefinition.md) | A boxed color value definition. |
|  [BoxedNumericDefinition](./harp-datasource-protocol.boxednumericdefinition.md) | A boxed numerical value definition. |
|  [BoxedSelectorDefinition](./harp-datasource-protocol.boxedselectordefinition.md) | A boxed selector value definition. |
|  [BoxedStringDefinition](./harp-datasource-protocol.boxedstringdefinition.md) | A boxed string value definition. |
|  [BufferAttribute](./harp-datasource-protocol.bufferattribute.md) | Structured clone compliant WebGL buffer and its metadata. |
|  [CirclesTechnique](./harp-datasource-protocol.circlestechnique.md) | Runtime representation of \[\[CirclesStyle\]\] as parsed by \[\[StyleSetEvaluator\]\]. For technique parameters see \[\[PointTechniqueParams\]\]. |
|  [CubemapSky](./harp-datasource-protocol.cubemapsky.md) | Interface that defines a cubemap sky. |
|  [DataTextureProperties](./harp-datasource-protocol.datatextureproperties.md) | Properties of a DataTexture (https://threejs.org/docs/\#api/en/textures/DataTexture). |
|  [DecodedTile](./harp-datasource-protocol.decodedtile.md) | This object has geometry data in the form of geometries buffers ready to be used by WebGL. These geometries are not <code>three.js</code> objects. They are pure data stored as <code>ArrayBuffer</code>s and metadata describing these buffers. |
|  [Definitions](./harp-datasource-protocol.definitions.md) | An array of \[\[Definition\]\]s. |
|  [DirectionalLight](./harp-datasource-protocol.directionallight.md) | Light type: directional.  \[ { "label": "New Directional Light", "description": "Adds a new Directional Light", "body": { "type": "directional", "name": "$<!-- -->{<!-- -->1:directional-light$:1<!-- -->}<!-- -->", "color": "\#$<!-- -->{<!-- -->2:fff<!-- -->}<!-- -->", "intensity": "^$<!-- -->{<!-- -->3:1<!-- -->}<!-- -->", "direction": { "x": "^$<!-- -->{<!-- -->4:1<!-- -->}<!-- -->", "y": "^$<!-- -->{<!-- -->5:0<!-- -->}<!-- -->", "z": "^$<!-- -->{<!-- -->6:0<!-- -->}<!-- -->" } } } \] |
|  [ExprVisitor](./harp-datasource-protocol.exprvisitor.md) |  |
|  [ExtrudedPolygonTechnique](./harp-datasource-protocol.extrudedpolygontechnique.md) | Runtime representation of \[\[ExtrudedPolygonStyle\]\] as parsed by \[\[StyleSetEvaluator\]\]. For technique parameters see \[\[ExtrudedPolygonTechniqueParams\]\]. |
|  [ExtrudedPolygonTechniqueParams](./harp-datasource-protocol.extrudedpolygontechniqueparams.md) | Technique used to draw a geometry as an extruded polygon, for example extruded buildings. |
|  [Feature](./harp-datasource-protocol.feature.md) | Represents "Feature" GeoJSON object. |
|  [FeatureCollection](./harp-datasource-protocol.featurecollection.md) | Represents "FeatureCollection" GeoJSON object. |
|  [FeatureDetails](./harp-datasource-protocol.featuredetails.md) | Feature details contains <code>feature.id</code>, <code>feature.properties.featureClass</code> which provides possibility to define style in theme for particular feature. |
|  [FillTechnique](./harp-datasource-protocol.filltechnique.md) | Runtime representation of \[\[FillStyle\]\] as parsed by \[\[StyleSetEvaluator\]\]. For technique parameters see \[\[FillTechniqueParams\]\]. |
|  [FillTechniqueParams](./harp-datasource-protocol.filltechniqueparams.md) | Technique used to draw filled polygons. |
|  [Fog](./harp-datasource-protocol.fog.md) | Interface that defines the options to configure fog. |
|  [FontCatalogConfig](./harp-datasource-protocol.fontcatalogconfig.md) | Fonts used for all text related rendering. |
|  [Geometry](./harp-datasource-protocol.geometry.md) | Structured clone compliant version of a <code>three.js</code> geometry object, consisting of buffers with metadata for map features and objects for example roads, trees or parks. |
|  [GeometryCollection](./harp-datasource-protocol.geometrycollection.md) | Represents "GeometryCollection" GeoJSON geometry object. |
|  [GradientSky](./harp-datasource-protocol.gradientsky.md) | Interface that defines a procedural gradient sky. |
|  [Group](./harp-datasource-protocol.group.md) | Structured clone compliant WebGL group object and its metadata. Its purpose is to make working with groups of objects easier. |
|  [HeightBasedColors](./harp-datasource-protocol.heightbasedcolors.md) | Interface containing the definition of different colors to be used at different heights with the \[\[TerrainTechnique\]\]. |
|  [IBloomEffect](./harp-datasource-protocol.ibloomeffect.md) |  |
|  [ImageDefinition](./harp-datasource-protocol.imagedefinition.md) | Define an image (e.g. icon). |
|  [ImageDefinitions](./harp-datasource-protocol.imagedefinitions.md) |  |
|  [ImageTexture](./harp-datasource-protocol.imagetexture.md) | Can be used to create a texture atlas. |
|  [IndexedTechniqueParams](./harp-datasource-protocol.indexedtechniqueparams.md) | Additional params used for optimized usage of <code>Techniques</code>. |
|  [InterleavedBufferAttribute](./harp-datasource-protocol.interleavedbufferattribute.md) | Structured clone compliant WebGL interleaved buffer with its metadata attached. |
|  [InterpolatedPropertyDefinition](./harp-datasource-protocol.interpolatedpropertydefinition.md) | Interpolated property could have its value (some initial value should be provided) changed according to an interpolation type.<!-- -->Here is an example of an interpolated property from a map style: "lineWidth": { "interpolation": "Linear", "zoomLevels": \[13, 14, 15\], "values": \[ 1.5, 1.2, 0.9\] } |
|  [IOutlineEffect](./harp-datasource-protocol.ioutlineeffect.md) |  |
|  [ISepiaEffect](./harp-datasource-protocol.isepiaeffect.md) |  |
|  [ITileDecoder](./harp-datasource-protocol.itiledecoder.md) | General type decoder which can be used to provide decoded tile data. |
|  [ITiler](./harp-datasource-protocol.itiler.md) | General type tiler which can be used to provide tile untiled payloads. |
|  [IVignetteEffect](./harp-datasource-protocol.ivignetteeffect.md) |  |
|  [JsonArray](./harp-datasource-protocol.jsonarray.md) | A type representing JSON arrays. |
|  [JsonObject](./harp-datasource-protocol.jsonobject.md) | A type representing JSON objects. |
|  [LabelRejectionLineTechnique](./harp-datasource-protocol.labelrejectionlinetechnique.md) | Technique to avoid label rendering on top of certain line geometries. For technique parameters see \[\[BaseTechniqueParams\]\]. |
|  [LineMarkerTechnique](./harp-datasource-protocol.linemarkertechnique.md) | Runtime representation of \[\[LineMarkerStyle\]\] as parsed by \[\[StyleSetEvaluator\]\]. For technique parameters see \[\[MarkerTechniqueParams\]\]. |
|  [LineString](./harp-datasource-protocol.linestring.md) | Represents "LineString" GeoJSON geometry object. |
|  [LineTechnique](./harp-datasource-protocol.linetechnique.md) | Runtime representation of \[\[LineStyle\]\] as parsed by \[\[StyleSetEvaluator\]\]. For technique parameters see \[\[LineTechniqueParams\]\]. |
|  [LineTechniqueParams](./harp-datasource-protocol.linetechniqueparams.md) |  |
|  [MarkerTechniqueParams](./harp-datasource-protocol.markertechniqueparams.md) | Technique that describes icons with labels. Used in \[\[PoiTechnique\]\] and \[\[LineMarkerTechnique\]\] (for road shields). |
|  [MultiLineString](./harp-datasource-protocol.multilinestring.md) | Represents "MultiLineString" GeoJSON geometry object. |
|  [MultiPoint](./harp-datasource-protocol.multipoint.md) | Represents "MultiPoint" GeoJSON geometry object. |
|  [MultiPolygon](./harp-datasource-protocol.multipolygon.md) | Represents "MultiPolygon" GeoJSON geometry object. |
|  [NoneStyle](./harp-datasource-protocol.nonestyle.md) |  |
|  [OptionsMap](./harp-datasource-protocol.optionsmap.md) | Interface for <code>OptionsMap</code> which describes a general structure of key-value pairs. |
|  [PathGeometry](./harp-datasource-protocol.pathgeometry.md) | This object keeps the path of the geometry. Space of the path depends on the use case, so could be either world or local tile space. |
|  [PoiGeometry](./harp-datasource-protocol.poigeometry.md) | Structured clone compliant version of a <code>three.js</code> geometry object with points of interest (POIs) to be rendered. It is composed of buffers with metadata for POI objects. |
|  [Point](./harp-datasource-protocol.point.md) | Represents "Point" GeoJSON geometry object. |
|  [PointTechniqueParams](./harp-datasource-protocol.pointtechniqueparams.md) | Possible parameters of \[\[PointTechnique\]\]. |
|  [PoiTableDef](./harp-datasource-protocol.poitabledef.md) | Interface for the JSON description of the \[\[PoiTable\]\]. It is being implemented in \[\[PoiTable\]\]. |
|  [PoiTableEntryDef](./harp-datasource-protocol.poitableentrydef.md) | Interface for the JSON description of the \[\[PoiTableEntry\]\]. The interface is being implemented as \[\[PoiTableEntry\]\]. |
|  [PoiTableRef](./harp-datasource-protocol.poitableref.md) | Definition for a \[\[PoiTable\]\] reference as part of the \[\[Theme\]\] object. |
|  [PoiTechnique](./harp-datasource-protocol.poitechnique.md) | Runtime representation of \[\[PoiStyle\]\] as parsed by \[\[StyleSetEvaluator\]\]. For technique parameters see \[\[MarkerTechniqueParams\]\]. |
|  [Polygon](./harp-datasource-protocol.polygon.md) | Represents "Polygon" GeoJSON geometry object. |
|  [PolygonalTechniqueParams](./harp-datasource-protocol.polygonaltechniqueparams.md) | Declares a a geometry as a polygon. |
|  [PostEffects](./harp-datasource-protocol.posteffects.md) |  |
|  [SegmentsTechnique](./harp-datasource-protocol.segmentstechnique.md) | Runtime representation of \[\[SegmentsStyle\]\] as parsed by \[\[StyleSetEvaluator\]\]. For technique parameters see \[\[SegmentsTechniqueParams\]\]. |
|  [SegmentsTechniqueParams](./harp-datasource-protocol.segmentstechniqueparams.md) | Declares a geometry as a segment. |
|  [ShaderTechnique](./harp-datasource-protocol.shadertechnique.md) | Special technique for user-defined shaders. For technique parameters see \[\[ShaderTechniqueParams\]\]. |
|  [ShaderTechniqueMaterialParameters](./harp-datasource-protocol.shadertechniquematerialparameters.md) |  |
|  [ShaderTechniqueParams](./harp-datasource-protocol.shadertechniqueparams.md) | Special technique for user-defined shaders. See https://threejs.org/docs/\#api/harp-materials/ShaderMaterial for details. |
|  [SolidLineTechnique](./harp-datasource-protocol.solidlinetechnique.md) | Runtime representation of \[\[SolidLineStyle\]\] as parsed by \[\[StyleSetEvaluator\]\]. For technique parameters see \[\[SolidLineTechniqueParams\]\]. |
|  [SolidLineTechniqueParams](./harp-datasource-protocol.solidlinetechniqueparams.md) | Declares a a geometry as a solid line. |
|  [SquaresTechnique](./harp-datasource-protocol.squarestechnique.md) | Runtime representation of \[\[SquaresStyle\]\] as parsed by \[\[StyleSetEvaluator\]\]. For technique parameters see \[\[PointTechniqueParams\]\]. |
|  [StandardExtrudedLineTechnique](./harp-datasource-protocol.standardextrudedlinetechnique.md) | Runtime representation of \[\[StandardExtrudedLineStyle\]\] as parsed by \[\[StyleSetEvaluator\]\]. For technique parameters see \[\[StandardExtrudedLineTechniqueParams\]\]. |
|  [StandardExtrudedLineTechniqueParams](./harp-datasource-protocol.standardextrudedlinetechniqueparams.md) | Declares a a geometry as a standard extruded line. |
|  [StandardTechnique](./harp-datasource-protocol.standardtechnique.md) | Technique used to render a mesh geometry. For technique parameters see \[\[StandardTechniqueParams\]\]. |
|  [StandardTechniqueParams](./harp-datasource-protocol.standardtechniqueparams.md) | Standard technique parameters. |
|  [StringEncodedNumeralFormat](./harp-datasource-protocol.stringencodednumeralformat.md) | Interface containing information about a \[\[StringEncodedNumeral\]\] format, component size and evaluation. |
|  [StylePriority](./harp-datasource-protocol.stylepriority.md) | A type representing symbolic render orders. |
|  [Styles](./harp-datasource-protocol.styles.md) | A dictionary of \[\[StyleSet\]\]s. |
|  [StyleSelector](./harp-datasource-protocol.styleselector.md) | Base \[StyleSelector\] attributes required to match \[Style\] object against given feature.<!-- -->Contains \[Style\]'s members related to feature matching in \[\[StyleSetEvaluator\]\]. |
|  [TerrainTechnique](./harp-datasource-protocol.terraintechnique.md) | Technique used to render a terrain geometry with textures. For technique parameters see \[\[TerrainTechniqueParams\]\]. |
|  [TerrainTechniqueParams](./harp-datasource-protocol.terraintechniqueparams.md) | Technique used to render a terrain geometry with a texture. When using this technique, the datasource will produce texture coordinates in local tile space (i.e. \[0,0\] at south-west and \[1,1\] at north-east tile corner). |
|  [TextGeometry](./harp-datasource-protocol.textgeometry.md) | Structured clone compliant version of a <code>three.js</code> geometry object with text to be rendered. It is composed of buffers with metadata for text objects. |
|  [TextPathGeometry](./harp-datasource-protocol.textpathgeometry.md) | This object keeps textual data together with metadata to place it on the map. |
|  [TextStyleDefinition](./harp-datasource-protocol.textstyledefinition.md) | Various text styles used with labels and texts. |
|  [TextTechnique](./harp-datasource-protocol.texttechnique.md) | Runtime representation of \[\[TextStyle\]\] as parsed by \[\[StyleSetEvaluator\]\]. For technique parameters see \[\[TextTechniqueParams\]\]. |
|  [TextTechniqueParams](./harp-datasource-protocol.texttechniqueparams.md) | Render geometry as a text. |
|  [TextureBuffer](./harp-datasource-protocol.texturebuffer.md) | Buffer holding a texture. |
|  [TextureProperties](./harp-datasource-protocol.textureproperties.md) | Properties of a Texture (https://threejs.org/docs/\#api/en/textures/Texture). |
|  [Theme](./harp-datasource-protocol.theme.md) | Map theme is used to define what features are shown and how the map is styled, for example which lightning is used or whether fog should be displayed. |
|  [TileInfo](./harp-datasource-protocol.tileinfo.md) | Defines a map tile metadata. |
|  [ValueMap](./harp-datasource-protocol.valuemap.md) |  |

## Namespaces

|  Namespace | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [ColorUtils](./harp-datasource-protocol.colorutils.md) | Utilities to convert RGBA colors encoded in custom number (hex) format to THREE.Color objects.<!-- -->The functions provided allows for conversion from and to our custom number based color format, which contains transparency, red, green and blue color channels in a way that each channel occupies 8 bits of resulting number (color format 0xTTRRGGBB). In order to preserve compatibility with THREE.Color class and its hexadecimal color representation, we do not store \_\_alpha\_\_ channel in encoded color's number, but replace it with \_\_transparency\_\_ channel, which is simply opposite to alpha: \`\`\`<!-- -->transparency = 0xFF - alpha<!-- -->\`\`\` Such channel value is stored on the oldest bits (octet) in the integral color (numeric) value, so it is fully compatible with THREE.Color numerical representation (<!-- -->@<!-- -->see \[\[THREE.Color.getHex\]\], \[\[THREE.Color.setHex\]\]). See also \[\[getHexFromRgba\]\] and \[\[getRgbaFromHex\]\] for more info about conversion. |
|  [WorkerDecoderProtocol](./harp-datasource-protocol.workerdecoderprotocol.md) | Communication protocol with \[\[ITileDecoder\]\]. |
|  [WorkerServiceProtocol](./harp-datasource-protocol.workerserviceprotocol.md) | Common communication protocol for \[\[WorkerService\]\]. |
|  [WorkerTilerProtocol](./harp-datasource-protocol.workertilerprotocol.md) | Communication protocol with \[\[ITiler\]\]. |

Is is suggested to specify multiple kinds for specific types of data. For a highway, the following list of kinds is suggested:<!-- -->\["line", "road", "road:highway"\]<!-- -->If it is a tunnel for a highway:<!-- -->\["line", "road", "road:highway", "tunnel", "road:tunnel", "road:highway:tunnel"\]<!-- -->If specified in this way, specific types of data (here: highway roads) can be enabled and/or disabled. |
